title: How to Make a Habit Irresistible
summary: Temptation bundling links an action you want to do with an action you need to do. By pairing habits you enjoy with habits you need to build, you can make good habits more attractive. The key is understanding that dopamine is released not just when you experience pleasure, but when you anticipate it.
keyIdeas: Temptation bundling makes habits more attractive by pairing them with things you enjoy.
Dopamine is released in anticipation of rewards, not just upon receiving them.
Make habits attractive by associating them with positive feelings.
The anticipation of a reward can be more motivating than the reward itself.
Link a habit you need to do with a habit you want to do.
Reframe your mindset to focus on benefits rather than drawbacks.
Habits become attractive when they're associated with positive outcomes.
examples: Only listen to your favorite podcast while exercising.
Watch your favorite show only while doing household chores.
Enjoy a special coffee only after completing your morning routine.
exercises: Create a temptation bundle: pair a habit you need with one you want.
Reframe a habit you resist by focusing on its benefits.
Identify what makes your favorite habits attractive and apply it to new ones.
reflections: What enjoyable activity could you pair with a habit you're struggling to build?
How can you reframe a difficult habit to make it more appealing?
